1.title: "Volunteering Family": Mastercard's new initiative
1.snippet: The "Volunteering Family" initiative, by Mastercard, Ruach Tova, and Ontopo, enables families to plan a day of giving back.
1.content:
The "Volunteering Family" initiative, by Mastercard, Ruach Tova, and Ontopo, enables families to plan a day of giving back. The project offers family volunteering opportunities, including the ability to search and book activities tailored to the family's preferences based on location in Israel and preferred volunteering sector.

The range of volunteering opportunities for the public is provided by Ruach Tova, part of the Arison Group, which promotes volunteering in Israel. They offer an online search engine that customizes volunteering options by various categories and geographic regions. The new platform allows families (especially those with children) to plan a day of doing good: coordinating in advance a volunteering activity from a wide variety of opportunities and then continuing the day at one of the local restaurants. Additionally, the initiative aims to support local businesses in Israel in the restaurant and café sectors, which have suffered since the outbreak of the war, by offering benefits to volunteering families at restaurants near the volunteering locations. The benefits and discounts, ranging from 10% to 15%, will be made accessible to the public through Ontopo.

Organizations such as the Society for the Protection of Nature in Israel, Leket Israel, the Monkey Shelter, SPCA, EcoOcean, Chesed Irith, the Yoqne'am Agricultural Education Farm, and others will offer family-friendly volunteering activities in the fields of environmental protection, animal welfare, working with vulnerable populations, and logistical assistance such as packing, organizing, and sorting food and other donations.

''Volunteering Family'' (credit: PR)

The volunteering selection process is simple and includes three short steps: selecting a suitable date, desired city, and a volunteering category close to the family’s heart. Finally, families can also choose one of the benefits offered by local businesses near the volunteering site.

Summing up previous activities reveals interesting data showcasing the scope of activities and the remarkable willingness of Israelis:

Approximately 4,400 volunteers participated in various activities during August, including walking (and adopting) 1,050 dogs, harvesting 15 tons of fruits and vegetables, collecting 625 bags of trash from 17 parks and streams, spending time with 240 elderly individuals, and packing and distributing 6,200 food baskets to those in need.

Carly Sanders, Marketing Manager at Mastercard Israel, notes: "The launch of the 'Volunteering Family' platform makes it possible for the first time, with just one click, to easily search and book a shared volunteering activity for the entire family. Following the success and the willingness of many families to volunteer during the summer, we are proud to extend the opportunity through December. The initiative stems from the understanding that family quality time is priceless. Parents realize that doing good together has educational value, and at the same time, creates unforgettable experiences and memories that money can't buy."

2.title: Capital One Cardholders Will Likely Move to Discover's Payment Network -- but Not Right Away
2.snippet: Capital One has said that it will transition its cards from the Visa and Mastercard payment networks to the Discover card network.
2.content:
This year, Capital One plans to acquire Discover for $35.3 billion. The date and details aren't final yet, but changes for both Discover and Capital One cardholders could be on the horizon.

"Capital One has said that it will transition its cards from the Visa and Mastercard payment networks to the Discover card network," said Jason Steele, a CNET Money expert review board member and credit card expert.

If you're a Capital One cardholder, experts don't expect major changes right away, but if the merger goes through, your card will likely be shifted to the Discover payment network eventually.

How changing payment networks could impact you

Discover is one of the four major credit card networks, along with Visa, Mastercard and American Express. Right now, Capital One offers both Visa and Mastercard credit cards but would likely slowly begin to shift their cards to the Discover network if the acquisition goes through.

Why does this matter? Discover's network is smaller than Visa and Mastercard and isn't accepted everywhere in the US or abroad.

"While many countries where Discover isn't widely accepted are places that aren't popular tourist destinations, some are," Steele said. For example, Discover isn't accepted in Panama, Kenya and Serbia, according to its website. In countries where Discover is accepted, the rules can vary by store. Steele also added that Discover isn't currently accepted at all major US retailers, such as Costco.

However, Capital One plans to expand Discover's payment network, which could increase its footprint overseas in the future. "We continue to believe that Visa and Mastercard play a very important part in Capital One's future, but that we can build a network and a network story that over time can take more of our volume," said Capital One's CEO, Richard Fairbank, at a Dec. 2024 Goldman Sachs Financial Services Conference.

Experts think that in the long run, this merger could spell good news for both Capital One and Discover cardholders, alike.

"Capital One acquired Discover in large part for its processing network," said Aaron Hurd, a credit card expert and CNET Money expert review board member. Hurd predicts that over time, Capital One will expand Discover's payment network, both overseas and in the US. This expansion would make it easier to use your Discover card abroad, as well as any Capital One cards that are moved to this network.

How to prepare for the Capital One and Discover merger

Hurd expects Capital One to continue operating both brands somewhat autonomously for some time. "Capital One probably won't alienate Discover's large customer base by discontinuing the Discover card brand," he said. Hurd does expect small changes to products after the acquisition.

If you depend on your Capital One credit card as your primary payment method, you'll likely eventually be ported over to the Discover network. Although there are plans to expand this payment network, if you're worried about traveling abroad, Steele suggests looking for a backup Visa or Mastercard option.

This acquisition isn't finalized, but experts expect it will pass. If the merger goes through, look for updates from either Discover or Capital One about any changes.

3.title: EazyPay wins Mastercard EDGE 2024 Award for innovating in crypto acceptance in MENA
3.snippet: EazyPay's achievement highlights its pioneering role in enabling the use of Mastercard cards to purchase cryptocurrencies. By facilitating seamless and secure...
3.content:
Manama, Bahrain – Eazy Financial Services “EazyPay”, a leading Bahraini financial institute specialized in Point-of-Sale (POS) and online payment gateway acquiring services, is proud to announce its win in the “Innovating in Crypto Acceptance in MENA” category at the Mastercard EDGE 2024 Awards. The ceremony, held on October 16th in Dubai, recognized EazyPay’s significant contributions to the digital payments industry, with the award presented to the company’s Founder and CEO, Nayef Tawfeeq Al Alawi.

Mastercard EDGE 2024 Awards were held as part of Mastercard EDGE, a forum to Envision the Future of Digital Gateways & E-Commerce. Now in its third edition, this year's theme, "The Technology Impact," focused on how innovations in digital payments and emerging technologies are transforming the payments landscape. The event brought together acquirers, payment service providers (PSPs), merchants, financial institutions, government bodies, and innovators in crypto and PayTech for bold, insightful discussions.

EazyPay’s achievement highlights its pioneering role in enabling the use of Mastercard cards to purchase cryptocurrencies. By facilitating seamless and secure transactions, EazyPay empowers customers to use their Mastercard cards to purchase cryptocurrencies with ease. Leveraging Mastercard’s global network and robust security features, EazyPay is bridging traditional payment methods with emerging digital assets, positioning itself as a key innovator in the MENA region.

Commenting on the prestigious award, Nayef Tawfeeq Al Alawi, Founder and CEO of Eazy Financial Services, stated, "This recognition underscores our commitment to driving financial innovation in the region. By enabling customers to use their Mastercard cards to purchase cryptocurrencies, we are providing them with secure, efficient, and cutting-edge payment solutions that are in line with the evolving demands of the digital economy. We are proud to be leading this transformation in the MENA region."

EazyPay continues to stand out as a frontrunner in Bahrain’s financial services sector, offering advanced POS and online payment solutions that empower its broad merchant base and customers. By delivering seamless and innovative payment services, EazyPay not only enhances transaction efficiency but also plays a pivotal role in shaping the digital payments landscape across the region.

5.title: Janindu Dilshan inspires CH & FC to a hard fought victory over Army SC
5.snippet: CH & FC hosted Army Sports Club at the Racecourse Stadium in a week 05 clash of the Mastercard Club Rugby League 2024/25. After a hard fought contest,...
5.content:
CH & FC hosted Army Sports Club at the Racecourse Stadium in a week 05 clash of the Mastercard Club Rugby League 2024/25. After a hard fought contest, the hosts managed to get the result in their favor 19-17.

Ashan Bandara executed a 50/22 and gave the team the opportunity to attack with a lineout. After the driving maul gained some good meters the forwards were patient and made some good inroads as a line offside penalty was also awarded. Kaveen Perera then scored the first try for Army Sports Club in the 27th minute of the game. The conversion unfortunately didn’t go through from Isuru Medagedara (CH 00 – 05 ASC)

CH & FC who lost Pasindu Bandara for continuous not rolling away infringements then knocked the ball forward inside their own 22m territory to make matters worse and Army Sports Club made use of the opportunity as Dhanushka Thalwatta produced a scintillating run and almost went all the way. Quick ball after that to the right of the field enabled Isuru Medagedara to score the 2nd try for the soldiers. However Medagedara missed another hard conversion (CH 00 – 10 ASC)

Just before the halftime whistle, the home skipper Janindu Dilshan took matters into his own hands and scored the first try with a phenomenal run from the right corner of the field. He laid the foundation for the try with a lovely territory gainer and finished the job by himself. The conversion didn’t go through but CH & FC were back in the hunt just before lemons (CH 05 – 10 ASC)

Halftime :- Army Sports Club (2T) 10 – 05 (1T) CH & FC

CH & FC scored a try to begin the 2nd half as the big Prop forward Deshan Vimukthi showcased his pure power to take his team towards the halfway mark and the backline then used the right corner of the field with some slick passing to go all the way as Udesh Madushanka finished the job. Janith Chandimal kicked the conversion through to give his team the lead (CH 12 – 10 ASC)

The hosts then found another try through Randitha Warnapura as the momentum continued to flow in favor of the home team. Chandimal kicked through a lovely angled conversion to increase their lead to 9 points (CH 19 – 10 ASC)

Army found some life back in the game going into the last 10 minutes as Mohomed Akram found the needed power to break through the final line of CH & FC defense to score an all important try. Gayan Salinda added the extra points to make it a 2 point game (CH 19 – 17 ASC)

Army Sports Club received a penalty just a couple of minutes before full time but that unfortunately went away from the left post by a whisker and there were no more opportunities for them to try and take back the lead as the home team got the job done by just 2 points.

CH & FC skipper Janindu Dilshan was named ThePapare Player of the Match for his brilliant performance which paved the way for his team’s turnaround in the 2nd half.

Full Time :- CH & FC 19 (3T 2C) Defeated Army SC 17 (3T 1C)

0.title: CES 2025: Mastercard’s Raja Rajamannar on how to stay authentic in agentic age
0.snippet: The road ahead. As we step into the agentic age, CMOs face a dual challenge: embracing new technologies while reconnecting with the fundamentals of human...
0.content:
The Drum catches up with the chief marketing and communications officer in Las Vegas to find out about his sensory-driven marketing strategy, Mastercard’s partnership with Netflix and more.

CES 2025 brought Las Vegas roaring back to life, buzzing with energy, innovation and, of course, buzzwords. This year, the term agentic dominated conversations – an evolution of generative AI that has profound implications for marketers. Sitting down with Raja Rajamannar, chief marketing and communications officer at Mastercard, I got a first-hand account of how his sensory-driven marketing strategy offers a roadmap for CMOs navigating this new era.

Want to go deeper? Ask The Drum

From generative to agentic: the AI shift

“It’s been a fantastic CES,” Rajamannar said. “AI is advancing at an unstoppable pace. Last year, we were all talking about generative AI. Now, it’s about agentic AI – everyone’s talking about it and it’s visible all over the place.”

For those unfamiliar, Rajamannar broke it down: “Generative AI provides options – it creates things, whether it’s images, travel itineraries, or book summaries. Agentic AI goes further. It makes decisions and takes actions on your behalf.” He likened it to a digital executive assistant, explaining: “Imagine asking your AI to find the best hotel in Vegas for CES and then booking it. It’s a game-changer for efficiency and accessibility.”

But what does this mean for marketing? Rajamannar’s answer was clear: marketers are no longer speaking directly to consumers but to their AI agents. “It’s an era of bot-to-bot marketing. Your machines are now marketing to consumers’ machines. I wrote about this in my book, Quantum Marketing, and it’s incredible to see it validated today.”

Advertisement

Multi-sensory marketing: beyond the screen

If agentic AI represents the future, multi-sensory marketing is the bridge that will get us there. For Mastercard, this isn’t a new concept – it’s been a cornerstone of its strategy for over a decade.

“Traditional marketing focuses on sight and sound – videos, ads, screens,” Rajamannar said. “But people have five senses. Why limit ourselves to two?” Mastercard’s multi-sensory strategy incorporates touch, taste and smell to create immersive experiences.

The results speak for themselves. “We’ve gone from number 87 on the BrandZ rankings to number 11. It’s proof that our strategy works.”

One standout example? The Priceless Experiences platform, which curates both digital and physical events tied to consumers’ passions. During the Fifa Women’s World Cup, Mastercard created a trophy that emitted sound when touched – a literal embodiment of their multi-sensory approach.

Advertisement

Partnering with Netflix: a vision for experiential marketing

This year at CES, Mastercard unveiled a new strategic partnership with Netflix. “Netflix has been exploring physical experiences tied to their shows and we saw an opportunity to collaborate.”

The partnership’s first venture? Netflix Bites – a series of themed restaurants inspired by popular shows such as Bridgerton. Mastercard customers can access exclusive perks, from early bookings to premium seating. “We even created signature cocktails like ‘Streaming Optimism’ to bring a fun, branded twist.”

But there’s a deeper lesson here. As Rajamannar pointed out, consumers are moving away from screen-based interactions and craving real-world experiences. “Our research shows people increasingly value experiences over things. Whether it’s dining out or traveling, they want to engage with the world. Partnering with Netflix lets us tap into this trend while creating unique value for our customers.”

Suggested newsletters for you Daily Briefing Catch up on the most important stories of the day, curated by our editorial team. Weekly Marketing Stay up to date with a curated digest of the most important marketing stories and expert insights from our global team. The Drum Insider Learn how to pitch to our editors and get published on The Drum.

The road ahead

As we step into the agentic age, CMOs face a dual challenge: embracing new technologies while reconnecting with the fundamentals of human experience. For Rajamannar, the key lies in balancing innovation with authenticity.

“Agentic AI will revolutionize how we target and engage consumers. But at the end of the day, marketing is about creating connections – and there’s no better way to do that than through experiences that resonate with all five senses.”

If CES 2025 proved anything, it’s that the future of marketing isn’t just about adapting to AI – it’s about using it to enhance the ways we connect, create and inspire. And for those willing to embrace the shift, the possibilities are truly priceless.

2.title: Don’t Sleep on Payment Card Interchange Fee Settlement
2.snippet: Jeffrey Schrimmer, president of Brighter Promotions, explains how promo firms can file a claim in the $5.5 billion settlement in an antitrust class action suit.
2.content:
Jeffrey Schrimmer, president of Brighter Promotions (asi/41016) hadn’t heard of the class action suit related to Visa and Mastercard interchange fees until a few months ago when a company he acquired retained their rights to any claims from the $5.5 billion settlement.

After learning more and filing a claim for his own company, Schrimmer launched a new business, Professional SRS, to help other companies navigate the process. In this episode of Promo Insiders, Schrimmer explains what the antitrust suit was all about, who can file a claim and why time is of the essence.

Businesses that accepted Visa or Mastercard payments between Jan. 1, 2004, and Jan. 25, 2019, are eligible to file a claim, but claims must be submitted by Feb. 4. Though it’s not certain how much of the settlement money individual businesses will recoup, Schrimmer believes it’s worth making the effort. “I hate to use the term, but it’s free money coming back to you,” he says. “It’s money you’ve already paid into these guys. You should get it back.”

Podcast Chapters 1:45 Details of the settlement.

3:29 How to make a claim.

5:21 How much settlement money might businesses receive?

8:38 Beware of potential scammers.

3.title: India's digital payments strategy is cutting out Visa and Mastercard
3.snippet: As digital payments morph into strategic assets, India is offering a template for other nations seeking to reduce dependence on Western payment networks.
3.content:
As digital payments morph into strategic assets, India is offering a template for other nations seeking to reduce dependence on Western payment networks.

Regulators around the world are notching up scrutiny on Visa and Mastercard over the fees they charge merchants, but India has chosen a different path: creating rival payment networks that are increasingly sidelining international card networks.

India's strategy builds on the Unified Payments Interface, known as UPI, a nine-year-old system that lets consumers and merchants bypass traditional card networks by connecting bank accounts directly through QR codes and phone numbers.

The UPI network now processes more than 13 billion real-time transactions monthly — that's about 71% of all transactions in the world's most populous nation — and accounts for 36% of all consumer spending in the country, according to an analysis by Bernstein.

UPI's dramatic success hasn't gone unnoticed. The local government has been leveraging the system's success to reshape its credit card market with RuPay, a homegrown card network. RuPay enjoys a crucial advantage: It's the only payment system allowed to process credit card transactions through UPI.

This exclusivity, granted only in 2022, is proving transformative: RuPay processed ₹638 billion ($7.43 billion) in UPI credit card transactions in the first seven months of fiscal year 2025, nearly double from a year earlier.

These figures now account for 28% of all credit card transactions in India, up from 10% last year, according to Bernstein. (RuPay's credit card figures don't include swipes at merchant outlets and some other transactions, as that data isn't available, so its market share is likely even higher.)

And last year, authorities began working aggressively to further popularize the adoption of RuPay credit cards, a push that many banks initially resisted, citing concerns about losing interchange fees.

The strategy involves careful calibration of fees. RuPay credit cards on UPI only charge merchants for transactions worth more than ₹2,000 ($23.3). This structure has particular appeal for small businesses that have historically resisted credit cards to avoid paying merchant fees, since the average UPI credit transaction currently runs lower than ₹1,000.

What's more, India's central bank last year ordered lenders to let consumers choose their card network when taking or renewing credit cards, prohibiting exclusive agreements with global networks. In August, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), which oversees both UPI and RuPay, directed banks to ensure RuPay cardholders receive the same rewards as other networks.

5.title: Mastercard brings Crypto Credential to UAE, Kazakhstan in fintech push
5.snippet: Mastercard Crypto Credential allows users to send and receive cryptocurrencies using simple aliases instead of complex blockchain addresses.
5.content:
Image credit: Getty Images

Global payments provider Mastercard has introduced its Crypto Credential solution to the UAE and Kazakhstan, marking its debut in the Eastern Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EEMEA) region.

Mastercard Crypto Credential allows users to send and receive cryptocurrencies using simple aliases instead of complex blockchain addresses. The system ensures that transactions proceed only when the recipient’s wallet supports the transferred asset, reducing the risk of failed or lost transactions.

“As the cryptocurrency landscape continues to mature, we’ve been laser focused on developing innovative services and capabilities that help make crypto more accessible and secure, streamline the transaction process and enhance trust in the ecosystem,” said Gaurang Shah, executive vice president and head of core payments for EEMEA at Mastercard.

“In bringing Mastercard Crypto Credential to the EEMEA region, we’re delivering on our vision to increase and instill trust in blockchain technology while also transforming the way that people interact with digital assets.”

The initiative, launched in collaboration with ATAIX Eurasia, Intebix, CoinMENA, and Fuze, is designed to enhance trust in blockchain transactions by verifying users and ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks, including the Travel Rule.

The Travel Rule is a global anti-money laundering (AML) regulation requiring financial institutions, including crypto exchanges, to share identifying information about the sender and recipient of transactions above a certain threshold.

Established by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), the rule applies to virtual asset service providers (VASPs) such as cryptocurrency exchanges and wallet providers. The objective is to prevent money laundering, fraud, and terrorism financing by ensuring transparency in cross-border and domestic digital asset transactions.

How it works and future expansion

Mastercard Crypto Credential operates through a verification and alias-based transaction process.

Users are verified under Mastercard Crypto Credential standards through participating exchanges. Once verified, they receive a unique alias to send and receive crypto across supported platforms. Finally, before a transaction is processed, the system checks if the recipient’s alias and wallet support the asset and blockchain. If not, the transaction is blocked, preventing potential fund losses.

While the pilot phase focuses on peer-to-peer transactions, Mastercard plans to expand Crypto Credential’s applications to NFTs, ticketing, and other payment solutions, subject to regulatory requirements.

With this expansion, the UAE and Kazakhstan join markets in North America, Europe, Latin America, and Asia Pacific, where the solution is already in use. A limited group of crypto wallet users will gain early access, with a broader rollout expected in the coming months.

Industry reaction

Industry leaders have welcomed the move, with Talal Tabba, CEO of CoinMENA, praising Mastercard’s efforts to build trust in digital assets.

“Innovations like Mastercard Crypto Credential program are key to building trust and making digital assets more accessible and user-friendly, especially for joiners from traditional finance,” Tabba said.

At a glance: With a 2% unlimited cash back earn rate on everything you buy—plus a boosted rate of 4% on eligible gas and grocery purchases—the SimplyCash Preferred Card from American Express will appeal to those looking for an easy-to-understand rewards structure without charts or restrictions.

featured Amex SimplyCash Preferred go to site Annual fee: $120 Rewards: 2% – 4% cash back 4% cash back on eligible gas and grocery purchases

2% cash back on everything else Welcome offer: Earn a bonus 10% cash back on all purchases for your first three months (up to $2,000 in purchases) and a $50 statement credit when you make a purchase in month 13 (total value of up to $250). go to site Card details Interest rates 21.99% on purchases, 21.99% on cash advances Income required None specified Credit score 725 or higher

Pros and cons Pros Earn a minimum of 2% cash back (most other cards in Canada have base earn rates of 0.5% to 1%). It’s also a great cash back credit card for online shoppers for that reason, too.

The 4% cash back earn rate on gas and grocery purchases is hard to beat for those who spent a lot in these categories. Plus, earn the base rate of 2% without any caps or annual limits.

Comes with some travel and car rental insurance.

Cons American Express cards are not as widely accepted as Visa or Mastercard.

Best secured credit card

At a glance: Perks aren’t usually the reason people get a secured credit card. They do so for the ability to simply put money on the card and then use it with ease—the card’s limit is how much money you put on it, from $500 to $10,000. However, the Home Trust Secured Visa has one sweet benefit that allows it to outshine other secured cards: For a yearly fee of $59, you can get an interest rate of 14.90%, significantly lower than the card’s regular rate of 19.99%. This card is a good secured option, especially for new Canadians, students or those wanting to improve their credit history. (Yes, a secured credit card helps with your credit rating.)

featured Home Trust Secured Visa go to site Annual fee: $0 Rewards: Does not offer rewards. Welcome offer: None at this time. go to site Card details Interest rates 19.99% on purchases and 19.99% on cash advances Income required None specified Credit score 300 or higher

Pros and cons Pros You decide your credit limit, and you can choose between two interest rates based on the annual fee: either a $59 annual fee and 14.90% interest rate, or a $0 annual fee and 19.99% interest rate.

Payments are reported to credit agencies, which can help build cardholders’ credit scores.

Cons This card doesn’t have much in the way of perks like insurance, rewards or cash back, as its purpose is to provide credit to people who have bad credit or who might not otherwise get approved.

A security deposit is required upfront.

Not available to residents of Quebec.

Advertisement

Best low-interest credit card

At a glance: Those looking for a low-interest credit card to help them pay down debt will want to check out the BMO Preferred Rate Mastercard. A low $20 annual fee, a regular interest rate of 13.99% on purchases, free additional cardholders and an appealing welcome offer all make this a strong package.

featured BMO Preferred Rate Mastercard go to site Annual fee: $29 Low interest rate: 13.99% on purchases Welcome offer: get a 0.99% introductory interest rate on balance transfers for 9 months with a 2% transfer fee go to site Card details Interest rates 15.99% on cash advances, 15.99% on balance transfers Income required $15,000 (personal or household) Credit score 660 or higher

Pros and cons Pros You can have the annual fee waived every year if you also have a BMO Performance chequing account.

Annual fee of $20 is affordable and you can add an additional cardholder for free.

Cons This card doesn’t come with any perks like insurance.

Best store credit card

At a glance: With the Triangle Mastercard, Canadians who regularly shop at Canadian Tire and partner stores will appreciate generous earn rates on purchases and the ability to easily redeem their CT Money. If you apply at a Canadian Tire store and are approved, you may use the card immediately. And if you apply online and are approved, you’ll be able to proceed to checkout right away with an instant virtual credit card. You can also use your card through the Apple Pay or Google Pay apps to make purchases before you receive your physical card in the mail.

Triangle Mastercard Annual fee: $0 Rewards: 1 – 4% 4% at Canadian Tire, Sport Chek, Mark’s/L’Équipeur, Atmosphere, Party City, Sports Rousseau, Hockey Experts and L’Entrepôt du Hockey

3% at grocery stores (excluding Walmart and Costco), up to $12,000 per year

1% everywhere else Welcome offer: None Card details Interest rates 19.99% on purchases, 22.99% on cash advances, 22.99% on balance transfers Income required Not specified Credit score Not specified Point value 1% in Canadian Tire Money is worth $0.01 when redeemed at participating retailers.

Pros and cons Pros This card has no annual fee.

With $1 in CT Money equalling CAD$1, the rewards program is simple to understand.

Triangle member can earn rewards at Petro stations.

Cons CT Money can only be redeemed at Canadian Tire and partner stores, so you’ll have to shop there to benefit from its rewards.

The 1.5% earn rate on groceries excludes purchases at Walmart and Costco, and is only available on the first $12,000 per year.

The participating gas partners, Gas+ and Essence+, aren’t nearly as ubiquitous as some other brands, so it’s unclear whether the ability to earn 5¢ per litre back on fuel will beat out competitor loyalty programs.

How we determine the best cards The MoneySense editorial team selects the best credit cards by assessing the value they provide to Canadians across various categories. Our best instant approval credit cards ranking is based on an extensive list of card details and features, including approval likelihood and speed, annual fees, interest rates, welcome offers, rewards earn rates, annual income requirements, and perks such as insurance coverage and purchase protection. We have also considered the pros and cons of each card to help you determine which ones best suit your financial needs. Our rankings are an unbiased source of information for Canadians. The addition of links from affiliate partners has no bearing on the results. Read more about how MoneySense makes money.

Advertisement

What does instant approval mean?

Instant approval credit cards offer an expedited approval process—saving you time and stress. Unlike with many regular credit cards, when you apply, you’ll know almost immediately whether you’ve been approved or if your application needs to go to a manual review.

With manual verification, it can take an additional two to three business days. If you’re approved, your application goes forward for credit checks while your card is printed and mailed. You can usually expect your card within five to seven business days, but some lenders allow you to start using your account even before it arrives.

Instant approval vs instant use

Many of the biggest credit card issuers in Canada offer instant approval, meaning you can apply for the card online and find out if you’re approved within minutes. However, only select cards offer instant use. That’s when you can start using the credit account digitally right after approval, before your physical card even arrives in the mail.

What do you need to get instantly approved for a credit card?

As with any credit card application, there are a few requirements you’ll need to meet in order to obtain an instant approval credit card.

You must be a permanent resident or Canadian citizen. (If you don’t meet this requirement, there are credit cards that allow applications without this criteria, such as secured credit cards.)

You must be the age of majority. In Canada, the age of majority is 18 or 19 years old and older, depending on your province of residence.

You must not have a history of bankruptcy if you’re applying for an unsecured credit card. Most rewards and low-interest credit card options are unsecured, but there are secured credit cards that you can apply for even if you’ve declared yourself bankrupt.

No matter the kind of credit card you’re applying for, a good credit score will increase your chances of being approved.

Before you start an instant approval application, make sure you have the following information at hand:

Your social insurance number (SIN)

Your employment information

Your income information

The application form may ask for other information, and some of it may be optional. The more details you provide, the more efficient the credit card approval process will be.

Once you’ve been approved, your application will still have to go out for proper credit checks. All cards require a credit check, except for secured cards and cards from an institution that you have an established relationship with. In some cases, you’ll be contacted for information or clarification. Shortly after, your card will be produced and mailed to the address on file.

What to do if your application for an instant approval card is declined

If your instant approval credit card application is declined, the good news is that you’ll usually know the reason immediately.

If you get a message that your application is being reviewed, it may not be declined—it may simply mean that the credit card issuer needs to verify your identity and information before making a decision. This may take an extra day or two.

Alternatively, if you get an instant decline, consider doing the following:

Review the credit card eligibility requirements, such as credit score and income, to see if you meet them.

Review your credit report to check for issues and errors. You can get your credit report for free from Equifax and TransUnion.

If needed, take steps to fix your credit report and improve your credit score.

Consider applying for another credit card with eligibility requirements that can you easily meet or exceed.

How to increase your odds of instant approval for a credit card

To improve your chances of getting an instant approval credit card, show the credit card issuer that your finances are in good standing. Having the following helps:

A good to excellent credit score: This tells the credit card issuer that you have a healthy credit utilization ratio and little to no debt.

This tells the credit card issuer that you have a healthy credit utilization ratio and little to no debt. A low number of credit inquiries: Avoid applying for too many credit cards, loans or lines of credit at the same time. These will temporarily affect your credit score as it suggests that you’re in need of money.

Avoid applying for too many credit cards, loans or lines of credit at the same time. These will temporarily affect your credit score as it suggests that you’re in need of money. An existing relationship with the credit card issuer: If you’re applying for a credit card from a bank where you already have a chequing or savings account, they can easily verify your income and credit history, making instant approval much more likely.

If you’re applying for a credit card from a bank where you already have a chequing or savings account, they can easily verify your income and credit history, making instant approval much more likely. Consistent income: Even if your credit card application isn’t instantly approved, any additional requests for information usually revolve around proof of income. If you’re asked for these, have your paystubs or bank statements ready to share with the credit card issuer.

Frequently asked questions

What is the easiest credit card to get in Canada? It’s important to remember that “instant approval” doesn’t mean “easy approval.” With instant approval cards, you still have to meet the eligibility criteria, which might include a minimum annual income and/or credit score. As a rule, secured cards and cards intended for people who are establishing or rebuilding their credit are the easiest to access. Does instant approval mean guaranteed approval? No. Even with an instant approval credit card, your application must be approved—but the process is super quick. Certain instant approval cards in Canada, like the Capital One Guaranteed Approval Mastercard, come with guaranteed approval, though conditions still apply. What features do instant approval credit cards offer? If you browse the list above, you’ll see that some instant approval cards have welcome offers and/or rewards in the form of cash back or points (check the “earn rate” to see which ones). You can also find cards with appealing perks. Does applying for an instant approval credit card impact my credit score? Yes. Think of the application process as being the same as any other credit card, just faster. When applying for an instant approval credit card, you’ll be asked to provide your personal information so that the card issuer can perform a credit check, which may temporarily knock down your credit score. With this in mind, avoid applying for multiple cards at the same time. Is there a credit card that approves everyone? Strictly speaking, no credit card will approve everyone. Even easy approval credit cards require checks on your creditworthiness and ensure you can pay back what you spend before approving your application. For a near guaranteed credit card, try applying for a secured credit card, which requires you to provide a cash deposit—it serves as collateral and usually dictates the spending limit on your credit card.

More of Canada’s best credit cards:

8.title: LOLC Finance leads with Sri Lanka’s first Braille-enabled Mastercard Credit Card
8.snippet: This innovative card features tactile Braille elements and a distinctive blind notch, enabling ease of use and greater accessibility.
8.content:
LOLC Finance has taken a pioneering step towards financial inclusivity by introducing Sri Lanka’s first Braille-enabled Mastercard credit card. Specifically designed for visually impaired individuals, this innovative card features tactile Braille elements and a distinctive blind notch, enabling ease of use and greater accessibility.



By addressing the unique needs of diverse communities, this initiative sets a new benchmark in Sri Lanka’s financial services sector, blending functionality with inclusivity.



Aligned with the campaign’s vision of “feeling the pulse of the people,” LOLC Finance is reshaping the financial landscape to be more inclusive. The Braille-enabled credit card series will extend across various offerings, including Pulse, Gold, Platinum, and World cards, as well as the women-focused SWAIREE card. The SAVI Card, the first in the Braille series, is tailored for visually impaired government sector employees and pensioners.



These cards go beyond accessibility by offering unique benefits and rewards, transforming everyday financial transactions into empowering experiences. From daily purchases to exclusive perks, the Braille-enabled range ensures a seamless financial journey for all users.



This initiative reaffirms LOLC Finance’s leadership in championing inclusivity and financial empowerment, paving the way for a future where accessibility is a standard, not an exception.

9.title: Changi Airport hacks for Chinese New Year 2025: how to save 2x 9% GST, score free parking and more
9.snippet: Discover how you can enjoy double GST absorption, rewards, and perks when you shop and dine at Changi Airport.
9.content:
A shopper’s paradise in an airport? That’s right. Changi Airport is more than just a world-class travel hub, it’s a shopper’s dream destination. Whether you’re jet-setting to your vacation destination or simply visiting the airport to shop and dine, discover how you can make the most of your shopping spree. Read on for hacks to maximise your savings, ensure that you earn the maximum GST rebates and shopping vouchers, and for drivers - how to park for free!

Enjoy GST-absorbed shopping all year round, with 2xGST savings on selected days (9% + 9% savings)

Changi Airport absorbs 9% Goods & Services Tax (GST) at participating retail outlets in the public areas of Terminals 1 to 4 for all Changi Rewards members. That’s an instant 9% discount on everything you buy, all year round.

Signing up for a free Changi Rewards membership is the first step to enjoy a myriad of savings at Changi Airport.

But that’s not all! On selected weekends, you can double your savings with an additional 9% off on top of the GST absorption with a nett minimum spend of S$30 in a single receipt.. That’s a 9% + 9% shaved off your purchases. Don’t miss these 2xGST promo dates: 10 to 12, 17 to 19, and 24 to 26 January 2025.

10, 11, and 12 January 2025 – Friday to Sunday;

17, 18, and 19 January 2025 – Friday to Sunday; and

24, 25, and 26 January 2025 – Friday to Sunday.

(Psst, learn the difference between Changi’s duty-free, tax-free, and GST-absorbed prices to help you get even more out of your spending!)

Also on 2xGST days: earn an additional S$9 return e-Voucher with a minimum spend of S$60 (that’s a 15% rebate!)

The savings don’t stop at 9% + 9% off on the 2xGST promo days. Get a S$9 Changi Pay return e-Voucher when you spend a minimum of S$60 with Mastercard via Changi Pay (using a Mastercard added to your Changi Pay wallet) at the same participating retail outlets. That’s an additional 15% rebate for every S$60 spent! The e-voucher is credited into your Changi Pay wallet immediately after the transaction, which means you can use it for your next purchase on the same day, maximising your trip to Changi Airport.

How to earn this S$9 Changi Pay return e-Voucher: Activate your Changi Pay account on the Changi App and pay with a Mastercard in your Changi Pay wallet (ensure the transaction is at least S$60). You will receive the return e-Voucher in your wallet instantly. T&Cs apply.

Use your Changi Rewards rebates to sweeten the deal (Up to 4% rebate)

Changi Rewards members earn rebates for shopping and dining spend across Changi Airport terminals and Jewel all year round.

On top of GST absorption, Changi Rewards members earn points for shopping and dining at Changi Airport with a minimum spend of S$10. Depending on your , you will earn an additional 0.5% to 4% rebate on your spend. For example, Gold members earn a 1% rebate in Changi Rewards points, redeemable for e-Voucher(s) or other partner rewards.

Chinese New Year exclusives: Redeem Hello Kitty and Friends red packets and mandarin orange bags

Ultra cute red packets featuring Hello Kitty and Friends (six designs per set) to welcome the Year of the Snake! Redeem mandarin orange bags (Hello Kitty or Kuromi) at S$8.80 each with minimum spend.

With all that 2xGST savings and perks, you can also redeem some of these Changi Airport-exclusive kawaii must-haves for Chinese New Year – Hello Kitty and Friends red packets and mandarin orange bags featuring Hello Kitty or Kuromi.

Redeem the complimentary set of red packets when you spend a minimum of S$80 (S$100 for supermarket) in a single receipt in the public areas of Changi Airport Terminals 1 to 4 (excluding Jewel). With the same minimum spend, you can purchase a mandarin orange bag at S$8.80.

Pro-tip: Be eligible to redeem an additional set of red packets and/or purchase an additional mandarin orange bag when you pay by Mastercard or Mastercard via Changi Pay with a minimum $80 spend.

Redeem these exclusive premiums at these collection points:

Terminal 3 Basement 2, Vending Machine near ST3PS

Terminal 4 Level 2 (Departure Hall), Vending Machine opposite Check-in Row 8

Festive feasting perks: Get S$15 e-vouchers when you spend S$100 or more dining in Changi Airport (15% rebate)

That’s not all. Enjoy special perks by Changi Airport this Chinese New Year season for your reunion meals and gatherings: Receive S$15 Changi Rewards CNY e-Vouchers when you spend a minimum of S$100 in a single receipt at participating F&B outlets in the public areas of Changi Airport.

Redeem e-Vouchers when you spend S$100 or more dining in Changi Airport

Remember to present your Changi Rewards e-Card when making payment at the F&B outlets, and the S$15 worth of Changi Rewards CNY e-Vouchers will be credited to your Changi Rewards account.

Park for free at Changi Airport for up to four hours

Parking perks are available for Changi Rewards Gold and Platinum members, and for members who spend more than S$35 with Mastercard from 10 January 2025 to 30 May 2025.

Finally, here’s the icing on the cake for those who drive: enjoy two hours of free parking when you spend a minimum of S$60 at the airport. This makes your trip to the airport a breeze, allowing you to shop and dine till your heart’s content and freeing you from parking woes.

Pro-tip: You can enjoy the same two-hour free parking with a lowered minimum spend of S$35 (in a single receipt) from 10 January 2025 to 30 May 2025 when you pay with your Mastercard.

The two-hour complimentary parking is in addition to free parking that Gold and Platinum Changi Rewards members enjoy daily with no minimum spend. From 2 May 2024, Gold members enjoy one hour of free parking daily, and Platinum members are entitled to two hours of free parking each day, all without any spending required. This is valid for all car parks in Changi Airport T1 to T4 and Jewel, including weekends and Public Holidays!

Stack on cashback or earn miles with your credit cards when you shop and dine at Changi Airport (~6% rebates)

For savvy shoppers and foodies who have been reaping the rewards from credit card spends, you can do the same at Changi Airport. And that’s another layer of rebates. Look for cards that offer generous rewards for dining, shopping, and contactless payments - you could easily earn approximately up to 8% cashback or 6 miles per dollar spent.

It’s not only dining, shopping and contactless payments categories that could earn you credit card rewards in Changi Airport. Here’s the secret: Transactions made through Changi Pay are categorised as online transactions by banks. This means you could earn even more rewards on your Changi Airport purchases if you are holding cards that reward you handsomely in the online spending category.

How to make the most of savings, rewards and rebates at Changi Airport

1. Mark your calendars. Here are the 2xGST dates - 10 to 12, 17 to 19, and 24 to 26 January 2025

2. Redeem Changi Airport-exclusive Hello Kitty and Friends red packets and mandarin orange bags. With a minimum spend of S$80 (S$100 for supermarket).

3. Plan your purchases. Check out for the 2xGST promo and identify brands that offer additional promotions. Some of the most popular products in Changi Airport for double GST savings include festive hampers, Bird’s Nest, Lingzhi, Cordyceps and more healthcare products from Eu Yan Sang (Terminals 2 & 3), local pastries and confectionery from Bengawan Solo (Terminal 3) and Bakery Cuisine (Terminal 4), decadent chocolates and gift sets from GODIVA (Terminal 3), and Bak Kwa (barbequed pork) from Bee Cheng Hiang (Terminals 2 & 4) and Fragrance Bak Kwa (Terminal 3).

4. Choose to dine at Changi Airport. Get S$15 Changi Rewards CNY e-Vouchers when you spend a minimum of S$100 in a single receipt at participating F&B outlets.

5. Download the Changi App and activate your Changi Pay wallet. Check with the friendly staff in stores and restaurants for Changi Rewards perks and if you can pay via Changi Pay.

6. Check your credit card benefits. Select the best cards to use for dining, shopping and contactless payments in Changi Airport.

7. Maximise Mastercard benefits. Recap - Earn a S$9 return Changi Pay e-Voucher with a minimum spend of S$60 on 2xGST days (Mastercard via Changi Pay only), and redeem an additional set of red packets and/or purchase an additional mandarin orange bag with a minimum spend of S$80 (Mastercard or Mastercard via Changi Pay).

8. Park for free. Hit S$35 minimum spend in a single receipt and pay by Mastercard for two hours of free parking (this is in addition to the one hour and two hours of complimentary parking for Changi Rewards Gold and Platinum members respectively).

With these hacks, you can reap the most rewards from shopping and dining at Changi Airport. Whether you’re picking up festive treats for Chinese New Year, travel essentials, or shopping for your favourite skincare essentials – the next time you’re visiting, take advantage of these amazing perks to shop smart and save big!

For more updates on Changi Airport, follow us on Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, X, Telegram and YouTube. You can also sign up for a Changi Account and have the latest news and articles delivered right to your inbox.

2.title: India’s digital payments strategy is cutting out Visa and Mastercard
2.snippet: As digital payments morph into strategic assets, India is offering a template for other nations seeking to reduce dependence on Western payment networks.
2.content:
As digital payments morph into strategic assets, India is offering a template for other nations seeking to reduce dependence on Western payment networks.

Regulators around the world are notching up scrutiny on Visa and Mastercard over the fees they charge merchants, but India has chosen a different path: creating rival payment networks that are increasingly sidelining international card networks.

India’s strategy builds on the Unified Payments Interface, known as UPI, a nine-year-old system that lets consumers and merchants bypass traditional card networks by connecting bank accounts directly through QR codes and phone numbers.

The UPI network now processes more than 13 billion real-time transactions monthly — that’s about 71% of all transactions in the world’s most populous nation — and accounts for 36% of all consumer spending in the country, according to an analysis by Bernstein.

UPI’s dramatic success hasn’t gone unnoticed. The local government has been leveraging the system’s success to reshape its credit card market with RuPay, a homegrown card network. RuPay enjoys a crucial advantage: It’s the only payment system allowed to process credit card transactions through UPI.

This exclusivity, granted only in 2022, is proving transformative: RuPay processed ₹638 billion ($7.43 billion) in UPI credit card transactions in the first seven months of fiscal year 2025, nearly double from a year earlier.

These figures now account for 28% of all credit card transactions in India, up from 10% last year, according to Bernstein. (RuPay’s credit card figures don’t include swipes at merchant outlets and some other transactions, as that data isn’t available, so its market share is likely even higher.)

And last year, authorities began working aggressively to further popularize the adoption of RuPay credit cards, a push that many banks initially resisted, citing concerns about losing interchange fees.

The strategy involves careful calibration of fees. RuPay credit cards on UPI only charge merchants for transactions worth more than ₹2,000 ($23.3). This structure has particular appeal for small businesses that have historically resisted credit cards to avoid paying merchant fees, since the average UPI credit transaction currently runs lower than ₹1,000.

What’s more, India’s central bank last year ordered lenders to let consumers choose their card network when taking or renewing credit cards, prohibiting exclusive agreements with global networks. In August, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), which oversees both UPI and RuPay, directed banks to ensure RuPay cardholders receive the same rewards as other networks.

The push seems to be working: RuPay accounted for half of all new credit cards issued in India in June 2024, according to a recent disclosure by a lawmaker in parliament.

“Assuming UPI linkage remains exclusive for RuPay cards, RuPay is likely to emerge as the dominant network for credit cards,” a Bernstein report on Friday read.

“Once the QR code based payments become dominant for credit based payments too, credit accounts of banks could be directly linked to the UPI network bypassing the cards,” the research firm wrote.

Facing such a strong push by the local government and changing consumer behavior, payment giants Visa and Mastercard have been forced to change how they operate in India. They have partnered with fintechs in recent months to extend card support to UPI-powered merchant terminals, used by more than 10 million shopkeepers in India. It’s quite the spectacle: The same card networks didn’t find it feasible to work with such small merchants just a couple years ago.

But those efforts might be too little, too late. The stratospheric growth of UPI is blowing away the credit card industry at large — credit cards’ market share in India’s digital payments fell to 21% in 2024 from 43% in 2018. For Visa and MasterCard, the threat is real, and the battle is about to go uphill if they don’t find a way to turn this opportunity into an advantage.

4.title: Mastercard Crypto Credential debuts in UAE and Kazakhstan
4.snippet: Mastercard has expanded its Mastercard Crypto Credential service to the UAE and Kazakhstan, made its entry into the EEMEA region.
4.content:
The Mastercard Crypto Credential service facilitates the verification of transactions among consumers and businesses using blockchain networks. Credit: Diego Thomazini/ Shutterstock.

Mastercard has expanded its Mastercard Crypto Credential service to the UAE and Kazakhstan.

With this move, the company has made its entry into the Eastern Europe, Middle East and Africa (EEMEA) region.

This solution is said to simplify consumer experience for crypto exchange users, allowing them to send and receive cryptocurrencies using aliases instead of blockchain addresses.

The Mastercard Crypto Credential service facilitates the verification of transactions among consumers and businesses using blockchain networks.

This expansion will enable exchanges such as ATAIX Eurasia, Intebix, and CoinMENA, as well as digital asset infrastructure provider Fuze to secure blockchain transactions for users in the region.

The service works by first verifying the user under the Mastercard Crypto Credential standards.

Once verified, the user is assigned an alias to send and receive funds across all supported exchanges.

When initiating a transfer, the solution verifies the recipient’s alias and confirms the support of the digital asset and associated blockchain. If any discrepancies arise, the transaction is halted, protecting users from potential loss.

It will initially focus on peer-to-peer transactions, with future capabilities potentially including NFTs, ticketing, and other payment solutions, subject to market and compliance requirements.

The solution is already active in North America, Europe, Latin America, and Asia Pacific, where it is already facilitating cross-border and domestic digital asset transfers.

A select group of crypto wallet users will have early access to the service on a “first-come, first-serve basis”, with wider availability expected to roll out across participating exchanges in the coming months.

Mastercard EEMEA Core Payments head and executive vice president Gaurang Shah said: “In bringing Mastercard Crypto Credential to the EEMEA region, we’re delivering on our vision to increase and instill trust in blockchain technology while also transforming the way that people interact with digital assets.”

Mastercard Crypto Credential went live in May 2024.

7.title: Yendo Mastercard® Review: Could This Card Help You Gain Access to Credit?
7.snippet: Yendo is an alternative to secured credit cards, but it requires you to put your car on the line and comes at a higher cost than many secured cards.
7.content:
Card Basics

Card type Mastercard Card issuer Cross River Bank Annual fee $40 Annual percentage rate (APR) 29.88% Foreign transaction fee 3% Card benefits Easy approval with no deposit required

Reports to the credit reporting agencies

Recently, my friend decided to buy a home. She had no credit history since she had steered clear of debt, so she needed to improve her credit score to get a mortgage. To do that, she applied for a secured credit card, which meant putting down a deposit. This option can help you show you're responsible and build your credit score, but not everybody can afford to do that.

The Yendo credit card is a Mastercard that you can get approved for by using your car as collateral. This alternative provides access to a credit line of up to $10,000 without making a cash deposit to secure the debt. This may seem like a good idea, but it's actually a high-risk strategy that I wouldn't recommend to my friend or anyone else.

When you request pre-approval, Yendo won't do a hard credit check. Rather than deciding whether to approve you solely based on your credit history, Yendo also considers details about your vehicle, expenses, and income. It will evaluate how much your car is worth versus what you owe on it to approve you for a credit line based on those factors and your ability to pay.

Once approved, you get instant access to a virtual card while you wait for the physical version. You'll pay a $40 annual fee and be able to charge up to your credit limit.

Yendo reports your payment history to the three credit reporting agencies. This is a big benefit because it can help you build credit. The big downside is that you risk losing your car if you don't make your payments.

Who should get the Yendo credit card?

The Yendo card isn't right for everyone. Let's look at situations where you may want to apply.

You have lots of equity in an eligible vehicle

To decide whether you can borrow and how much you can get, Yendo considers the amount of equity you have in your vehicle. That's the amount you owe versus the value of the car. For example, if your car is worth $15,000 and has a $7,000 loan balance remaining, your equity would be $8,000. Yendo also requires that the car works and is no older than a 1996 model.

If you don't have sufficient equity in an eligible vehicle, Yendo won't approve you, and if you have very little equity, you may get a very low credit limit. Keep in mind your overall finances will also impact your credit limit and approval. You could qualify for anywhere from $450 to $10,000, so consider whether your potential credit line is sufficient for your borrowing needs.

You want to build credit but can't make a deposit

Most secured cards allow you to make a deposit, which may or may not equal your credit line, to qualify. You can use that card responsibly and pay the bills on time to build credit. This is the type of card my friend got to improve her score.

Since Yendo doesn't require a deposit, it can be a good option if you can't afford to tie up your money. Remember, though, that rather than putting your cash on the line, you're putting your vehicle at risk.

In exchange for credit, Yendo requires providing your car's title if you own it outright or transferring the auto loan if you're still making payments. However, you do retain ownership of the vehicle while you have the card.

You're confident you won't default

Before applying for the Yendo card, you must be 100% confident you will never charge more than you can pay back. If you fail to fulfill your obligations, you could lose your car. You don't want to take a chance of this happening unless you trust yourself not to overspend. You might find Yendo a bigger risk than simply losing a bank deposit like with a regular secured card.

What should you know before applying?

Before deciding on a Yendo card, you should weigh the risks of secured vs. unsecured debt.

If you have unsecured debt, your lender only has your promise to repay it since there's no physical property as collateral. If you don't pay, the lender could take steps such as charging fees or sending the account to collections. In serious cases, the lender might take you to court and potentially garnish your wages or put a lien on your property to enforce the judgment. However, it's very rare to actually lose your property with unsecured debt.

With secured debt, you put up an asset as collateral. The lender gets an ownership interest (lienholder) and can take the asset if you don't pay. With the Yendo card, you're using your vehicle to guarantee the credit line, and you take the very big risk that you could lose your car if you fall behind in payments.

Top benefits of the Yendo credit card

Here are some of the biggest benefits of the Yendo secured card.

You can build credit: Yendo reports to Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion. It can be hard to find a lender willing to give you a credit line or loan if you don't already have good credit, so this is a major benefit for building credit to work toward goals like buying a home.

Yendo reports to Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion. It can be hard to find a lender willing to give you a credit line or loan if you don't already have good credit, so this is a major benefit for building credit to work toward goals like buying a home. You can refinance your car loan: If you apply for the card and still have a car loan, refinancing it through Yendo might lower your monthly car payments.

If you apply for the card and still have a car loan, refinancing it through Yendo might lower your monthly car payments. You don't have to put down a deposit: My friend had to put down a $200 deposit to get a card with a $200 limit. Not everyone can afford to tie up money like this, and Yendo avoids this potential roadblock.

My friend had to put down a $200 deposit to get a card with a $200 limit. Not everyone can afford to tie up money like this, and Yendo avoids this potential roadblock. You might get access to a large credit limit: Many secured cards have low limits that might start at just a few hundred dollars. Yendo allows you to borrow as much as $10,000 depending on how much equity you have in your vehicle and your overall financial situation.

Why you might want a different credit card

There are also some big disadvantages of the Yendo card, including:

There's a $40 annual fee: Some secured cards don't charge you just to be a cardholder, and the annual fee can get costly alongside Yendo's high APR.

Some secured cards don't charge you just to be a cardholder, and the annual fee can get costly alongside Yendo's high APR. You could lose your car: It's a much bigger problem if your car is repossessed than if you lose a few hundred dollars with a secured card that just requires a cash deposit. You might prefer a traditional secured card with a low deposit requirement to avoid that high risk and still get access to credit.

It's a much bigger problem if your car is repossessed than if you lose a few hundred dollars with a secured card that just requires a cash deposit. You might prefer a traditional secured card with a low deposit requirement to avoid that high risk and still get access to credit. You'll pay foreign transaction fees: Using your card abroad can get expensive due to Yendo's 3% foreign transaction fee, which you can avoid with some alternative cards.

Using your card abroad can get expensive due to Yendo's 3% foreign transaction fee, which you can avoid with some alternative cards. You won't earn any credit card rewards: Many other cards, including some secured options, allow you to earn rewards on your purchases. Unfortunately, Yendo doesn't.

Alternative credit cards to consider

When you're trying to build credit, carefully research the best credit cards to see which one makes sense for you. This is especially important if you are looking for secured cards because they can come with high costs. Here are three cards that might be better options for you than Yendo.

Discover it® Secured Credit Card

The Discover it® Secured Credit Card allows you to qualify by making a refundable deposit. You can open an account with as little as $200. This is a lot less risky than putting your car on the line. You can earn rewards on purchases and Discover will match all the cash back you’ve earned at the end of your first year. There's also a $0 annual fee.

This is the card I told my friend to get. If it's at all possible to save up $200 and your goal is to build credit rather than gain access to the largest credit line, consider choosing the Discover it Secured Credit Card rather than using Yendo.

Read our Discover it Secured Credit Card review.

BankAmericard® ️ Secured Credit Card

The BankAmericard®️ Secured Credit Card allows you to gain access to between $200 and $5,000 in credit, depending on your deposit amount. There is a $0 annual fee, and you get cardholder benefits, including free monthly FICO score updates for keeping tabs on your credit-building efforts.

Bank of America will also periodically review your card to see if you qualify to get part of your refund returned to you. This is a huge benefit since you may eventually qualify for some unsecured debt.

Capital One Platinum Secured Credit Card

The Capital One Platinum Secured Credit Card offers the option to get pre-approved with no damage to your credit and lets you gain access to a line of credit with a deposit of $49, $99, or $200. Your deposit is refundable, and over time, you can become eligible to upgrade to an unsecured Capital One Platinum card.

There's a $0 annual fee for this secured card, and you can make additional deposits to raise your credit line to as high as $1,000. With the low deposit requirements, this option can be a great choice if you're worried about affordability.

Read our Capital One Platinum Secured Credit Card review.

FAQs

Is Yendo worth it? Yendo isn't a good option for many people. You have to put your car on the line to gain access to a line of credit. Other secured cards don't require this, and some also allow you to borrow without the $40 annual fee that Yendo charges. How is my credit limit determined with Yendo? Yendo determines your credit line based on your ability to pay and the equity in your vehicle, which is how much your car is worth versus the amount you owe on it. Your vehicle's value depends on factors such as its condition, model, and mileage. Is Yendo a real credit card? Yendo provides you with a line of credit guaranteed by your vehicle and will send you a Mastercard to use for purchases, balance transfers, and cash advances. While it's a real credit card, Yendo differs from most other cards because your car is the collateral. How long does it take to get a Yendo card? You can get pre-approved for a Yendo card in two to three minutes and receive a virtual card as soon as you provide the required documentation, including your car's title if you own it outright, and get final approval. You'll have to wait longer for the physical card to arrive.

Bottom line

If you don't mind risking your vehicle for access to a line of credit and paying a $40 annual fee to do it, Yendo could work for you. Just make sure that you can control your spending and not miss any monthly payments while you use this card to build your credit.

If Yendo doesn't seem like the best financial choice, choosing a regular secured credit card is a far better option. You can look for secured cards that have low deposit requirements and no annual fees and then rework your budget to save up for the deposit. Once you build your credit, consider looking for traditional credit cards with more perks and no collateral requirements.

9.title: National Bank World Elite Mastercard Review 2025: Is It Worth It?
9.snippet: The National Bank World Elite Mastercard is worth it for cardholders who can leverage its 5x earn rate and travel perks to offset its $150 annual fee. For...
9.content:
With 5x points on groceries and restaurants, capped at $2,500 monthly, the National Bank World Elite Mastercard offers one of the highest earn rates in these categories. However, its strict income requirements and complex welcome offer might deter some applicants.

4.6 /5 4.6 NerdWallet rating National Bank World Elite Mastercard Annual fee $150 Interest rates 20.99% / 22.49% Rewards rate 1x-5x Points View details

National Bank World Elite Mastercard full review

The National Bank World Elite Mastercard is a mid-priced rewards card tied to the National Bank’s À la carte Rewards Plan. Cardholders earn points that can be redeemed for travel, merchandise, financial products, and more.

This card caters to frequent travelers and those who spend heavily on groceries and dining, but its value depends on how well you maximize its features and redemption options.

Benefits of the National Bank World Elite Mastercard

Generous earn rates: Earn 5x points per dollar on groceries and dining (up to $2,500 per month), with a 2x rate applying after the cap is reached. All other purchases earn 1x points.

Flexible redemption options : Use points to book travel, contribute to an RRSP or TFSA, pay down your credit card bill, or even apply them toward your mortgage.

Premium travel perks: Enjoy free, unlimited access to the National Bank Lounge at Montréal-Trudeau Airport (international trips only, with a 3-hour limit).

Valuable travel reimbursement: Receive up to $150 annually for eligible travel expenses, such as airport parking or baggage fees.

Comprehensive insurance: Robust travel coverage includes medical insurance, trip cancellation, and interruption insurance, plus a two-year extended warranty on eligible purchases — longer than most comparable cards.

Discounted banking fees: Cardholders receive reduced fees on select National Bank account packages.

Drawbacks of the National Bank World Elite Mastercard

Monthly cap on 5x rewards: The high earn rate for groceries and dining drops to 2x after $2,500 in monthly spending, regardless of the category. While competitive, this limitation may not suit high spenders.

Restricted lounge access: Free lounge visits are only available for international flights and limited to three hours.

High income requirements: Applicants must earn $80,000 individually or $150,000 as a household, making this card inaccessible for some applicants.

Variable point value: The value of À la carte Rewards points depends on redemption. Points are worth 1 cent each when booking through the À la carte Travel Agency (10,000 points = $100), but other methods may offer significantly lower values.

No transfer options: Points cannot be transferred to other loyalty programs, which limits flexibility for frequent flyers.

Complex welcome offer: The 40,000 bonus points requires you to complete several steps over 15 months, which might feel overly complicated for a reward that isn’t particularly generous.

Who should get the National Bank World Elite Mastercard?

Travellers, dining enthusiasts, and big grocery spenders seeking to offset travel costs will get the most out of this card, especially if they prioritize travel insurance.

Is the National Bank World Elite Mastercard worth it?

The National Bank World Elite Mastercard is worth it for cardholders who can leverage its 5x earn rate and travel perks to offset its $150 annual fee. For example:

Spending $3,000 annually on groceries and dining at the 5x rate earns enough points to cover the annual fee if redeemed through the À la carte Travel Agency (where points are worth 1 cent each).

Alternatively, using the $150 annual travel reimbursement effectively cancels out the annual fee.

National Bank customer ratings Below average in customer satisfaction: The National Bank ranks 8th out of 13 issuers in J.D. Power’s 2024 Canada Credit Card Satisfaction Study.

Low Trustpilot rating: The National Bank of Canada scored 1.6 out of 5 possible stars based on over 75 customer reviews, as of this writing.

Low Better Business Bureau rating: The National Bank of Canada scored 1 out of 5 possible stars based on just two customer reviews, as of this writing.

National Bank World Elite Mastercard eligibility

Who qualifies for the National Bank World Elite Mastercard?

To qualify for the National Bank World Elite Mastercard, you must be the age of majority in your province or territory and a Canadian resident.

You must also meet one of the following requirements:

Have a gross annual income of at least $80,000 ($150,000 per household).

Be an existing National Bank customer and make a minimum of $25,000 in transactions with your card annually.

Have at least $400,000 in investable assets.

Approximate credit score needed for approval

Canadian credit card issuers rarely disclose required credit scores, which makes it hard to know your chances of approval when comparing credit cards. However, higher scores generally mean better chances of approval, and that’s true regardless of the type of credit you’re applying for.

Want to learn more? Visit our “What Credit Score is Needed for a Credit Card?” page.

National Bank World Elite Mastercard rewards

welcome offer ongoing rewards card value Earn up to 40,000 points by unlocking the following offers: 5,000 points when you sign up for at least three months of payment insurance.

5,000 points when you make $5,000 net purchases in the first three months.

10,000 points when you make $10,000 net purchases in the first six months.

20,000 points when you make $15,000 in purchases in the first 12 months. Offer ends March 31, 2025. 5x per dollar on groceries and restaurants (drops to 2x after you spend $2,500 each month).

2x per dollar on gas, electric vehicle charging, recurring bill payments, and bookings made through the À la carte Travel Agency.

1x per dollar on all other eligible purchases. According to the National Bank website and À la carte Rewards Centre, 10,000 points equal $100 (1 cent per point) when redeemed through the À la carte Travel Agency. Points may have different values when redeemed for other purchases or for reimbursement.

How to apply for the National Bank World Elite Mastercard

Follow the below steps to apply for the National Bank World Elite Mastercard:

Navigate to the World Elite Mastercard page on the National Bank website and click the Apply now button.

Accept the terms and conditions.

Provide your personal contents details and income information.

Submit requested information about credit card payment insurance and consents.

Verify your identity.

Submit your application.

National Bank World Elite Mastercard vs BMO Ascend World Elite Mastercard
